meanings.definition: A type of plant tissue that provides structural support
meanings.sent1: The sclerenchyma in the plant stem helps it stand tall and strong.
meanings.sent2: The tree's trunk is reinforced by sclerenchyma, keeping it sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the sclerenchyma as a tightrope, but it was too rigid.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like sclerenchyma, unyielding and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The sclerenchyma fibers intertwined like a fortress around the plant's core.

meanings.definition: Cells with thick, lignified cell walls
meanings.sent1: The sclerenchyma cells have tough walls that provide protection.
meanings.sent2: When examining the leaf under a microscope, the sclerenchyma cells were clearly visible.
meanings.sent3: The sclerenchyma walls were so strong, even the microscope had trouble penetrating them.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was as unyielding as the sclerenchyma cell walls.
meanings.sent5: The sclerenchyma walls stood like ancient fortifications against any harm.

meanings.definition: Fibrous cells found in plant stems and roots
meanings.sent1: The sclerenchyma fibers provide reinforcement to the plant's structure.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts study the distribution of sclerenchyma in different plant species.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried to use the sclerenchyma fibers as a hammock, but it was too rigid.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the intertwining sclerenchyma fibers, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The sclerenchyma fibers in the roots resembled a network of sturdy ropes supporting the plant.
